items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River and lake levels continue to remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall. The lake level is forecast to remain above the Flood Alert threshold until tomorrow, 03/10/2022. Flooding could affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River and lake levels are forecast to begin falling, but the risk of flooding to low-lying land remains. We are clearing debris from weed screens in the area and will continue to monitor levels closely. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 03/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for reduced flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
